derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: back-formation from obsolete gadling 'wanderer, vagabond', (earlier) 'companion', of Germanic origin
late 15th cent.: euphemistic alteration of God

encyclopedia.content: 在英文字典里有闲逛的意思。也有解释说是一种精神疾病，主要症状是长期的、持久的、与任何特定处境无关的不安和紧张。可有许多非特异性的生理反应，如颤抖、紧张、出汗、头昏目眩和易怒。 注： gad1 KK: [] DJ: [] vi. 1. 【口】【旧】游荡，闲荡[(+about/abroad/out)] We spent the whole day gadding about Paris. 我们一整天都在巴黎游玩。 2. 追求刺激 3. 蔓延，蔓生 n. 1. 游荡，闲荡[U] He is always on the gad. 他老是闲

entry.def: If you gad about, you go to a lot of different places looking for amusement or entertainment.

example.ex: Don't think you'll keep me here while you gad about.
example.tran: 甭指望你去四处闲荡的时候我会呆在这儿。

means.word_mean: 1. a sharp prod fixed to a rider's heel and used to urge a horse onward;

sentences.sentence: "cowboys know not to squat with their spurs on"

means.word_mean: 1. wander aimlessly in search of pleasure
